Miles Sound System SDK 6.6h

AIL_last_error

The function AIL_last_error returns a string describing the last MSS error.

char * AIL_last_error();

Returns

A pointer to the MSS error string.

Discussion

If no errors have occurred since AIL_startup was called, the MSS error string's first byte will be 0, indicating an empty string.

Example files that use this function: DEMO.C


Group: System Services
Related Functions: AIL_file_fss_read, AIL_file_read, AIL_init_sequence, AIL_midiOutOpen, AIL_open_3D_provider, AIL_open_XMIDI_driver, AIL_open_digital_driver, AIL_quick_startup, AIL_startup, AIL_waveOutOpen
Related Basic Types: char, char *
